oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Willie Nelson interview part 1 - Biff Collie Inside Nashville
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part one of a recording of an interview with Willie Nelson (performer), conducted by Biff Collie (host) for his radio program Inside Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Willie Nelson introduction for Cross Country Magazine -- Willie Nelson introduction for Cross Country Magazine -- Willie Nelson introduction for Cross Country Magazine -- Willie Nelson introduction for Cross Country Magazine -- Willie Nelson introduction for Inside Nashville with Biff Collie -- Willie Nelson radio bumper -- Willie Nelson radio bumper -- Willie Nelson talks [unintelligible audio] -- Willie Nelson talks about Tommy Jackson (incomplete) -- Nelson talks about Bob Wills being a huge inspiration -- Nelson talks about the first time he sang with Bob Wills -- Nelson talks about Bob Wills writing the liner notes for his album -- Nelson talks about starting playing music at 10 years old and how his family were music teachers -- Nelson talks about learning to read music, site read and sing (incomplete) -- Nelson talks about playing music with his sister early on and that Willie's main instrument was always guitar -- Nelson talks about playing all the sports when he was young (incomplete) -- Nelson talks about some of his lifelong friends (incomplete) -- Nelson talks about signing autographs (incomplete) -- Nelson talks about being a disc jockey, a salesman for encyclopedias, and other odd jobs -- Nelson says that having money is better than not having money (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Nelson, Willie, 1933-;
